title: Why We Love Music
excerpt: Researchers are discovering how music affects the brain, helping us to make sense of its real emotional and social power.

title: ChillsDB: an open-source database of chills-inducing stimuli
excerpt: ChillsDB is the first database of validated audiovisual stimuli eliciting aesthetic chills (goosebumps, psychogenic shivers) in the US population.

title: How our brains process music and why we like what we like | Press Play
excerpt: How long does it take before you change the station or hit “skip” if you don’t like a song? Seconds — according to researchers at New York University.

title: This 715-song playlist is scientifically verified to give you the chills, thanks to "frisson"
excerpt: Listening to some songs can cause a powerful physiological response known as "frisson." What is it, and why does it happen?

title: Dissecting the Bloodthirsty Bliss of Death Metal
excerpt: Fans of this violent music report feelings of transcendence and positive emotions; psychologists want to learn why.
